result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony C Brown Jr.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 9.16.22

Defendant Anthony Brown not in court.  Attorney Jeff Schwarz for  Ashley Fard in court for Anthony Brown.  Attorney James Griffin for Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court takes no action as to bail.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Anthony Brown not in court.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Anthony Brown.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski.

Case in court for a plea and sentencing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Case adjourned for calendar call in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Calendar call scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9/1/22
Turnover to Justice Point for level 5 supervision with all previously ordered conditions of bail.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $300.00 cash.

Defendant Anthony C Brown in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Anthony C Brown in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Filed, amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. case adjourned, Branch 2. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony C Brown in court with Attorney Ashley Fard; both appear by video.  Defendant Anthony C Brown in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Cabral. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Matter is set for arraignment due to the new facts as to Count 1. Defense to be heard on bail as to the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Arraignment scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony C Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Attorney Fard is unavailable; out of the office. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Anthony C Brown in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Anthony C Brown in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony C Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
